question: Will $MATIC (Polygon) be above $2 on November 6?
description:
This is a market on whether the candlestick close price of Polygon $MATIC will be above $2.00 for the date and time of November 6, 2021, at 11:30 AM ET. 

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/polygon). 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if, according to the resolution source, $MATIC has a candlestick closing price of greater than $2.00 for the resolution date, November 6, 2021, 11:30 AM ET after 11:30 AM ET has passed. 
Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”. 

(To see the candlestick close price, click the candlestick icon, observe the number after the “C:” when you hover over a candlestick for a given time period.)

This market will resolve on the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Sat 6 November 2021, 11:30:00” with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 11:30:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:00:00 AM ET and the closing price for 11:30:00 AM ET. 

To allow for updates, this market will resolve on the number listed for the referenced candle at exactly 11:50:00 AM ET, on November 6, 2021. Note: If the candlestick closing price is exactly 2.00, the market will resolve "No." If CoinGecko is unavailable at resolution time, another source will be used.

question: Who will win UFC 268: Covington vs Usman?
description:
This is a market on the UFC 268 fight between Colby Covington and Kamaru Usman, set to take place on November 6, 2021, at the Madison Square Garden in New York.

This market will resolve to “Covington” if Colby Covington is declared the winner of the bout, either by KO, TKO, submission, DQ, or decision. 

This market will resolve to “Usman” if Kamaru Usman is declared the winner of the bout, either by KO, TKO, submission, DQ, or decision. 

If the fight ends in a draw or no contest, this market will resolve to 50-50. If the fight is rescheduled to a date on or before November 13, 2021, the same rules will apply. If the fight is postponed to a date after November 13, 2021, or canceled altogether, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: 2021 World Series: Who will win Braves v. Astros Game 5 on October 31st
description:
In the MLB 2021 World Series Game 5:

If the Atlanta Braves win, the market will resolve to “Braves.”

If the Houston Astros win, the market will resolve to “Astros.”

If the game is not completed by November 6, 2021, the market will resolve 48-52 favoring “Astros.”

----------------------------------------------

The 2021 World Series is the championship series of Major League Baseball's (MLB) 2021 season.
The 117th edition of the World Series is a best-of-seven playoff played between the National League (NL) champion Atlanta Braves and the American League (AL) champion Houston Astros.

The series began on October 26, with a potential Game 7 scheduled for November 3. Current score after two games: 3-1, favoring Braves

Game 5 is scheduled to start on October 31, 8:15 pm EDT and will be played in Truist Park, Atlanta, GA.

question: Will Squid Game be the #1 Netflix show worldwide on November 7?
description:
This is a market on whether the Netflix show, Squid Game, will hold the number one spot on Netflix’s daily Top Shows worldwide ranking on November 7th 2021, 8:00 pm ET. 

The resolution source will be FlixPatrol, which ranks the most-watched movies and TV shows across streaming platforms. 

The resolution source will be checked at 8:00 pm ET on November 7th, under "Netflix Top 10 TV Shows." (https://flixpatrol.com/top10/netflix/)

If "Squid Game" holds #1, the market will resolve to "Yes," otherwise the market will resolve to "No." 

If the resolution source is unavailable at the resolution time, it will be checked every 12 hours until the data is available, and the most recent data will be used to resolve the market. After November 14th, if the data is still unavailable, this market resolves 50/50.
